DOC.HEADLINE: BRIEFLY : TECHNOLOGY
DOC.TEXT: Semiconductor Book-to-Bill Ratio Goes Up : The industry ratio for the North_American market increased in December , according to statistics collected by World Semiconductor Trade Statistics and released by the San Jose-based Semiconductor Industry Assn.December bookings in the North_American market ( orders based on a three-month moving average ) were $ 2.276 billion -- up 3.0 % from the $ 2.210 billion recorded in November -- and 20.0 % higher than the $ 1.896 billion figure posted in December , 1992 . The December book-to-bill ratio is 1.04. November ' s preliminary ratio remains unchanged at 0.99. A book-to-bill ratio of 1.04 means that for every $ 100 worth of products shipped ( billed ) , manufacturers received $ 104 worth of new orders ( bookings ) .
